teacheasy.mediahandler

Class VideoHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.mediahandler.VideoHandler

  • public class VideoHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles video objects on a page, including their addition and deletion as well as maintaining their state. Video objects are added by supplying the relevant data from the data structure. This class is used by the renderer when redrawing pages.
    Version:
    1.0 24 Feb 2015
    Author:
    Alistair Jewers

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoHandler

        public VideoHandler(javafx.scene.Group nGroup,
            javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.stage.WindowEvent> nFullScreenCloseHandler)
        Constructs the video handler.
        Parameters:
        nGroup - The group this handler should place videos in.
        nFullScreenCloseHandler - An event handler to trigger events when fullscreen is exited. Wavemedia required.

    • Method Detail

      • createVideo

        public void createVideo(float x,
               float y,
               float width,
               java.lang.String sourcefile,
               boolean autoPlay,
               boolean loop)
        Adds a video to the group associated with the handler.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for the top left of the video relative to the groups origin.
        y - The y coordinate for the top left of the video relative to the group's origin.
        width - The width of the video in pixels.
        sourcefile - Absolute path of the video as a string. Can be a local file path or a web address beginning with 'http'
        autoPlay - If true video plays as soon as created.
        loop - If true video loops to beginning once it ends.

      • getVideoWidth

        public double getVideoWidth(int videoId)
        Returns the width of the selected video.
        Parameters:
        videoId - The ID of the video.

        Causes a video handled by the handler to play.

      • scanVideo

        public void scanVideo(int videoId,
             double percent)
        Causes a video handled by the handler to change playback position.
        Parameters:
        videoId - The ID of the video to be played.
        percent - The time in the video to move playback to as a percentage of the total time.

      • resizeVideo

        public void resizeVideo(int videoId,
               float nWidth)
        Causes a video handled by the handler to change size
        Parameters:
        videoId - The ID of the video to be played.
        nWidth - The new width for the video.

      • relocateVideo

        public void relocateVideo(int videoId,
                 float nx,
                 float ny)
        Causes a video handled by the handler to change location
        Parameters:
        videoId - The ID of the video to be played.
        nx - The new x location in pixels
        ny - The new y location in pixels

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(int videoId,
              boolean visible)
        Causes a video handled by the handler to change visibility
        Parameters:
        videoId - The ID of the video to be played.
        visible - The new visibility setting as a boolean.
